Catalog.Name: BESTDR8
Catalog.Description: This is a copy of the Sloan Digital Sky Survey Data Release 8 (SDSS DR8) hosted by the Wide Field Astronomy Unit (WFAU), University of Edinburgh. WFAU would like to thank John Hopkins University and the University of Chicago for permission to host the data.

Table.Name: SpecObjAll
Table.Description: Contains the measured parameters for a spectrum

Column.Name: specObjID
Column.Description: Unique database ID based on PLATE, MJD, FIBERID, RUN2D

Column.Name: sciencePrimary
Column.Description: Best version of spectrum at this location (defines default view SpecObj)

Column.Name: legacyPrimary
Column.Description: Best version of spectrum at this location, among Legacy plates

Column.Name: seguePrimary
Column.Description: Best version of spectrum at this location, among SEGUE plates (defines default view SpecObj)

Column.Name: firstRelease
Column.Description: Name of first release this object was associated with

Column.Name: primTarget
Column.Description: target selection information at plate design, primary science selection (for backwards compatibility)

Column.Name: secTarget
Column.Description: target selection information at plate design, secondary/qa/calib selection (for backwards compatibility)

Column.Name: legacy_target1
Column.Description: for Legacy program, target selection information at plate design, secondary/qa/calib selection

Column.Name: legacy_target2
Column.Description: for Legacy program, target selection information at plate design, secondary/qa/calib selection

Column.Name: special_target1
Column.Description: for special programs, target selection information at plate design, secondary/qa/calib selection

Column.Name: special_target2
Column.Description: for special programs, target selection information at plate design, secondary/qa/calib selection

Column.Name: SEGUE1_target1
Column.Description: SEGUE-1 target selection information at plate design, primary science selection

Column.Name: SEGUE1_target2
Column.Description: SEGUE-1 target selection information at plate design, secondary/qa/calib selection

Column.Name: SEGUE2_target1
Column.Description: SEGUE-2 target selection information at plate design, primary science selection

Column.Name: SEGUE2_target2
Column.Description: SEGUE-2 target selection information at plate design, secondary/qa/calib selection

Column.Name: cx
Column.Description: x of Normal unit vector in J2000

Column.Name: cy
Column.Description: y of Normal unit vector in J2000

Column.Name: cz
Column.Description: z of Normal unit vector in J2000

Column.Name: DOF
Column.Description: Degrees of freedom in best fit

Column.Name: rChi2Diff
Column.Description: Difference in reduced chi-squared between best and second best fit

Column.Name: tFile
Column.Description: File name of best fit template source

Column.Name: tColumn_0
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #0

Column.Name: tColumn_1
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #1

Column.Name: tColumn_2
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #2

Column.Name: tColumn_3
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #3

Column.Name: tColumn_4
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #4

Column.Name: tColumn_5
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #5

Column.Name: tColumn_6
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #6

Column.Name: tColumn_7
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #7

Column.Name: tColumn_8
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #8

Column.Name: tColumn_9
Column.Description: Which column of the template file corresponds to template #9

Column.Name: nPoly
Column.Description: Number of polynomial terms used in the fit

Column.Name: velDispZ
Column.Description: Redshift associated with best fit velocity dispersion

Column.Name: velDispZErr
Column.Description: Error in redshift associated with best fit velocity dispersion

Column.Name: velDispChi2
Column.Description: Chi-squared associated with velocity dispersion fit

Column.Name: velDispNPix
Column.Description: Number of pixels overlapping best template in velocity dispersion fit

Column.Name: velDispDOF
Column.Description: Number of degrees of freedom in velocity dispersion fit

Column.Name: wCoverage
Column.Description: Coverage in wavelength, in units of log10 wavelength

Column.Name: zWarning
Column.Description: Bitmask of warning values; 0 means all is good

Column.Name: snMedian
Column.Description: Median signal-to-noise over all good pixels

Column.Name: chi68p
Column.Description: 68-th percentile value of abs(chi) of the best-fit synthetic spectrum to the actual spectrum (around 1.0 for a good fit)

Column.Name: fracNSigma_1
Column.Description: Fraction of pixels deviant by more than 1 sigma relative to best-fit

Column.Description: Fraction of pixels deviant by more than 2 sigma relative to best-fit

Column.Name: spectroSynFlux_g

Column.Name: spectroSynFlux_r
Column.Description: Best-fit template spectrum projected onto r filter

Column.Description: Best-fit template spectrum projected onto i filter

Column.Name: spectroFluxIvar_g
Column.Description: Inverse variance of spectrum projected onto g filter

Column.Name: spectroFluxIvar_r
Column.Description: Inverse variance of spectrum projected onto r filter

Column.Name: spectroSynFluxIvar_i

Column.Name: spectroSkyFlux_r
Column.Description: Sky spectrum projected onto r filter

Column.Name: spectroSkyFlux_i

Column.Name: anyAndMask
Column.Description: for each bit, records whether any pixel in the spectrum has that bit set in its ANDMASK

Column.Name: anyOrMask
Column.Description: for each bit, records whether any pixel in the spectrum has that bit set in its ORMASK

Column.Name: plateSn2
Column.Description: Overall signal to noise measure for plate

Column.Name: snTurnoff
Column.Description: Signal to noise measure for MS turnoff stars on plate (-9999 if not appropriate)

Column.Name: elodieFileName
Column.Description: File name for best-fit Elodie star

Column.Name: elodieZModelErr
Column.Description: Standard deviation in redshift among the 12 best-fit stars

Table.Name: TwoMass
Table.Description: 2MASS point-source catalog quantities for matches to SDSS photometr

Column.Name: errMaj
Column.Description: Semi-major axis length of the one sigma position uncertainty ellipse

Column.Name: errMin
Column.Description: Semi-minor axis length of the one sigma position uncertainty ellipse

Column.Name: errAng
Column.Description: Position angle on the sky of the semi-major axis of the position uncertainty ellipse (East of North)

Column.Name: j
Column.Description: default J-band apparent magnitude (Vega relative, no Galactic extinction correction

Column.Name: jIvar
Column.Description: inverse variance in J-band apparent magnitude

Column.Name: h
Column.Description: default H-band apparent magnitude (Vega relative, no Galactic extinction correction

Column.Name: hIvar
Column.Description: inverse variance in H-band apparent magnitude

Column.Name: k
Column.Description: default K-band apparent magnitude (Vega relative, no Galactic extinction correction

Column.Name: kIvar
Column.Description: inverse variance in K-band apparent magnitude

Column.Name: rdFlag
Column.Description: Read flag. Three character flag, one character per band [JHKs], that indicates the origin of the default magnitudes and uncertainties in each band (see 2MASS PSC documentation)

Column.Name: blFlag
Column.Description: Blend flag. Three character flag, one character per band [JHKs], that indicates the number of components that were fit simultaneously when estimating the brightness of a source (see 2MASS PSC documentation)

Column.Name: ccFlag
Column.Description: Contamination and confusion flag. Three character flag, one character per band [JHKs], that indicates that the photometry and/or position measurements of a source may be contaminated or biased due to proximity to an image artifact or nearby source of equal or greater brightness. (See 2MASS PSC documentation).

Column.Name: nDetectJ
Column.Description: Number of frames on which 2MASS source was detected in J-band

Column.Name: nDetectH
Column.Description: Number of frames on which 2MASS source was detected in H-band

Column.Name: nDetectK
Column.Description: Number of frames on which 2MASS source was detected in K-band

Column.Name: nObserveJ
Column.Description: Number of frames which 2MASS source was within the boundaries of in J-band

Column.Name: nObserveH
Column.Description: Number of frames which 2MASS source was within the boundaries of in H-band

Column.Name: nObserveK
Column.Description: Number of frames which 2MASS source was within the boundaries of in K-band

Column.Name: galContam
Column.Description: Extended source "contamination" flag. A value of gal_contam="0" indicates no contamination. "1" indicates it is probably an extended source itself (this does not detect all such cases!). "2" indicates it is within the boundary of a large XSC source. (See 2MASS PSC documentation).

Column.Name: mpFlag
Column.Description: Minor planet flag. "1" if source associated with known solar system object, "0" otherwise. (See 2MASS PSC documentation).

Column.Name: ptsKey
Column.Description: Unique identification number for the PSC source.

Column.Name: hemis
Column.Description: Hemisphere code for the 2MASS Observatory from which this source was observed. "n" means North (Mt. Hopkins); "s" means South (CTIO).

Column.Name: jDate
Column.Description: Julian Date of the source measurement accurate to +30 seconds. (See 2MASS PSC documentation).

Column.Name: dupSource
Column.Description: Duplicate source flag. Used in conjunction with the use_src flag, this numerical flag indicates whether the source falls in a Tile overlap region, and if so, if it was detected multiple times. (See 2MASS PSC documentation)

Column.Name: useSource
Column.Description: Use source flag. Used in conjunction with the dup_src flag, this numerical flag indicates if a source falls within a Tile overlap region, and whether or not it satisfies the unbiased selection rules for multiple source resolution. (See 2MASS PSC documentation).

Table.Name: FieldMask
Table.Description: Contains the FieldMask flag values from DataConstants as binary(4

Table.Name: HoleType
Table.Description: Contains the HoleType enumerated values from DataConstants as in

Table.Name: PhotoStatus
Table.Description: Contains the PhotoStatus flag values from DataConstants as binary(4

Table.Name: SDSSConstants
Table.Description: This table contains most relevant survey constants and their physical unit

Table.Name: SiteDiagnostics
Table.Description: This table stores the full diagnostic snapshot after the last revisio

Column.Name: type
Column.Description: System type of the object (U:table, V:view, F: function, P: stored proc)

Table.Name: PubHistory
Table.Description: This table keeps the record of publishing into a tabl

Column.Name: name
Column.Description: the name of the table we publish into

Column.Name: tend
Column.Description: the time the table was published

Column.Name: loadversion
Column.Description: the taskid where it came from

Table.Name: ProfileDefs
Table.Description: This table contains the radii for the Profiles tabl

Column.Name: cell
Column.Description: the first cell in the annulus

Column.Name: aDisk
Column.Description: The area of the disk to outerRadius

Table.Name: sdssTilingRun
Table.Description: Contains basic information for a run of tiling Contains basic information for a run of tilin

Column.Name: primTargetMask
Column.Description: bit mask for target types to be tiled

Column.Name: secTargetMask
Column.Description: bit mask for target types to be tiled

Table.Name: sppTargets
Table.Description: Derived quantities calculated by the SEGUE-2 target selection pipeline

Column.Name: PSFMAGERR_u
Column.Description: Error in u band PSF magnitude

Column.Name: PSFMAGERR_g
Column.Description: Error in u band PSF magnitude

Column.Name: PSFMAGERR_r
Column.Description: Error in u band PSF magnitude

Column.Name: PSFMAGERR_i
Column.Description: Error in u band PSF magnitude

Column.Name: PSFMAGERR_z
Column.Description: Error in u band PSF magnitude

Column.Name: ORIGINALPLATEID
Column.Description: Original plate ID hash (if targeted based on previous spectrum)

Column.Name: ORIGINALSPECOBJID
Column.Description: Original spectroscopic object ID (if targeted based on previous spectrum)

Column.Name: ORIGINALPLATE
Column.Description: Original plate number (if targeted based on previous spectrum)

Column.Name: ORIGINALMJD
Column.Description: Original Modified Julian Date (if targeted based on previous spectrum)

Column.Name: ORIGINALFIBERID
Column.Description: Original fiber number (if targeted based on previous spectrum)(if targeted based on previous spectrum)

Column.Name: SEGUE1_TARGET1
Column.Description: SEGUE-1 target selection information at plate design, primary science selection

Column.Name: SEGUE1_TARGET2
Column.Description: SEGUE-1 target selection information at plate design, secondary/qa/calib selection

Column.Name: SEGUE2_TARGET1
Column.Description: bitmask that records the category or categories for which this object passed the selection criteria

Column.Name: SEGUE2_TARGET2
Column.Description: bitmask that records the category or categories of "standards" for the pipeline, special calibration targets like Stetson standards or globular cluster stars, for which this object passed the selection criteria

Column.Name: umgERR
Column.Description: PSFMAGERR_u and PSFMAGERR_g added in quadrature

Column.Name: gmrERR
Column.Description: PSFMAGERR_g and PSFMAGERR_r added in quadrature

Column.Name: rmiERR
Column.Description: PSFMAGERR_r and PSFMAGERR_i added in quadrature

Column.Name: imzERR
Column.Description: PSFMAGERR_i and PSFMAGERR_z added in quadrature

Column.Name: scolor
Column.Description: -0.249*uMag+0.794*gMag-0.555*rMag+0.234+0.011*p1s-0.010 (Helmi et al. 2003) used in SEGUE-1 target selection, unused in SEGUE-2

Column.Name: p1s
Column.Description: 0.91*umg+0.415*umg-1.280 (Helmi et al. 2003) used in SEGUE-1 target selection, unused in SEGUE-2

Column.Name: Mi
Column.Description: 4.471+7.907*imz-0.837*imz*imz used in SEGUE-1 target selection, unused in SEGUE-2

Column.Name: DISTi
Column.Description: 10^((iMag-Mi+5)/5.0) used in SEGUE-1 target selection, unused in SEGUE-2

Column.Name: VTRANS_GALREST
Column.Description: transvere velocity, km/s, derived from TOTALPM and DISTV_KPC, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

Column.Name: MUTRANS_GALRADREST
Column.Description: derived PM (mas/year) perpendicular to the Galactocentric radial vector, assuming all motion is along a Galactocentric radial vector, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

Column.Name: MURAD_GALRADREST
Column.Description: derived PM (mas/year) along the Galactocentric radial vector, assuming all motion is along a Galactocentric radial vector, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

Column.Name: VTOT_GALRADREST
Column.Description: total velocioty, km/s, derived from TOTALPM and DISTV_KPC, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

Column.Name: VTRANS_TOHV
Column.Description: transverse velocity in Galactocentric coords, using the distance estimate from MG_TOHV which is appropriate for old stars near the MSTO and corrected for peculiar solar motion 16.6 km/s toward RA,Dec 267.5,28.1

Column.Name: PM1SIGMA_TOHV
Column.Description: Estimate of the 1-sigma error in total proper motion at this r magnitude. Formula is sqrt(4.56*4.56 + frate*2.30*2.30), where frate is 10^(0.4*(rMag-19.5)). The constants come from the Munn et al. 2004 (AJ, 127, 3034) paper describing the recalibration of USNOB with SDSS.

Column.Name: V1SIGMAERR_TOHV
Column.Description: The corresponding 1-sigma error in the transverse velocity based on PM1SIGMA_TOHV and the the distance estimate using MG_TOHV

Table.Name: sdssTile
Table.Description: A view of sdssTileAll that have untiled=

Column.Name: cx
Column.Description: x projection of vector on unit sphere

Column.Name: cy
Column.Description: y projection of vector on unit sphere

Column.Name: cz
Column.Description: z projection of vector on unit sphere

Column.Name: untiled
Column.Description: 1: this tile later "untiled," releasing targets to be assigned to another tile, 0: otherwise

Column.Name: nTargets
Column.Description: number of targets assigned to this tile

Table.Name: AtlasOutline
Table.Description: Contains a record describing each AtlasOutline objec

Column.Name: objID
Column.Description: Unique Id number, composed of rerun, run, camcol, field, objid

Table.Name: SpecDR7
Table.Description: Contains the spatial cross-match between DR8 SpecObjAll and DR7 primaries

Column.Name: specObjID
Column.Description: Unique DR8 ID based on PLATE, MJD, FIBERID, RUN2D

Column.Name: dr7ObjID
Column.Description: Unique DR7 PhotoPrimary ID composed from [skyVersion,rerun,run,camcol,field,obj].

Column.Name: obj
Column.Description: The object id within a field. Usually changes between reruns of the same field.

Column.Name: nChild
Column.Description: Number of children if this is a composite object that has been deblended. BRIGHT (in a flags sense) objects also have nchild == 1, the non-BRIGHT sibling.

Column.Name: type
Column.Description: Morphological type classification of the object.

Column.Name: probPSF
Column.Description: Probability that the object is a star. Currently 0 if type == 3 (galaxy), 1 if type == 6 (star).

Column.Name: insideMask
Column.Description: Flag to indicate whether object is inside a mask and why

Column.Name: modelMagErr_u
Column.Description: better of DeV/Exp magnitude fit error

Column.Name: modelMagErr_g
Column.Description: better of DeV/Exp magnitude fit error

Column.Name: modelMagErr_r
Column.Description: better of DeV/Exp magnitude fit error

Column.Name: modelMagErr_i
Column.Description: better of DeV/Exp magnitude fit error

Column.Name: modelMagErr_z
Column.Description: better of DeV/Exp magnitude fit error

Column.Name: status
Column.Description: Status of the object in the survey

Column.Name: primTarget
Column.Description: Bit mask of primary target categories the object was selected in.

Column.Name: secTarget
Column.Description: Bit mask of secondary target categories the object was selected in.

Column.Name: htmID
Column.Description: 20-deep hierarchical trangular mesh ID of this object

Column.Name: fieldID
Column.Description: Link to the field this object is in

Column.Name: pmRaErr
Column.Description: Error in proper motion in right ascension.

Column.Name: pmDecErr
Column.Description: Error in proper motion in declination.

Column.Name: delta
Column.Description: Distance between this object and the nearest matching USNO-B object.

Column.Name: match
Column.Description: Number of objects in USNO-B which matched this object within a 1 arcsec radius. If negative, then the nearest matching USNO-B object itself matched more than 1 SDSS object.

Table.Name: segueTargetAll
Table.Description: SEGUE-1 and SEGUE-2 target selection run on all imaging dat

Column.Name: lcolor
Column.Description: SEGUE-1 and -2 target selection color: -0.436*uMag+1.129*gMag-0.119*rMag-0.574*iMag+0.1984 (Lenz et al.1998)

Column.Name: scolor
Column.Description: SEGUE-1 target selection color: -0.249*uMag+0.794*gMag-0.555*rMag+0.234+0.011*p1s-0.010 (Helmi et al. 2003)

Column.Name: p1s
Column.Description: SEGUE-1 target selection color: 0.91*umg+0.415*umg-1.280 (Helmi et al. 2003)

Column.Name: Mi
Column.Description: 4.471+7.907*imz-0.837*imz*imz used in SEGUE-1 target selection, unused in SEGUE-2

Column.Name: disti
Column.Description: 10^((iMag-Mi+5)/5.0) used in SEGUE-1 target selection, unused in SEGUE-2

Column.Name: vtrans_galrest
Column.Description: transvere velocity, km/s, derived from TOTALPM and DISTV_KPC, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

Column.Name: mutrans_galradrest
Column.Description: derived PM (mas/year) perpendicular to the Galactocentric radial vector, assuming all motion is along a Galactocentric radial vector, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

Column.Name: murad_galradrest
Column.Description: derived PM (mas/year) along the Galactocentric radial vector, assuming all motion is along a Galactocentric radial vector, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

Column.Name: vtot_galradrest
Column.Description: total velocity, km/s, derived from TOTALPM and DISTV_KPC, in a frame at rest w.r.t the Galaxy

Column.Name: vtrans_tohv
Column.Description: transverse velocity in Galactocentric coords, using the distance estimate from MG_TOHV which is appropriate for old stars near the MSTO and corrected for peculiar solar motion 16.6 km/s toward RA,Dec 267.5,28.1

Column.Name: pm1sigma_tohv
Column.Description: Estimate of the 1-sigma error in total proper motion at this r magnitude. Formula is sqrt(4.56*4.56 + frate*2.30*2.30), where frate is 10^(0.4*(rMag-19.5)). The constants come from the Munn et al. 2004 (AJ, 127, 3034) paper describing the recalibration of USNOB with SDSS.

Column.Name: v1sigmaerr_tohv
Column.Description: The corresponding 1-sigma error in the transverse velocity based on PM1SIGMA_TOHV and the the distance estimate using MG_TOHV

Table.Name: Photoz
Table.Description: The photometrically estimated redshifts for all objects in the Galaxy view

Column.Name: objID
Column.Description: unique ID pointing to Galaxy table

Column.Name: z
Column.Description: photometric redshift; estimated by robust fit to nearest neighbors in a reference set

Column.Name: zErr
Column.Description: estimated error of the photometric redshift; if zErr=-1000, all the proceeding columns are invalid

Column.Name: nnCount
Column.Description: nearest neighbors after excluding the outliers; maximal value is 100, much smaller value indicates poor estimate

Column.Name: nnVol
Column.Description: gives the color space bounding volume of the nnCount nearest neighbors; large value indicates poor estimate

Column.Name: nnIsInside
Column.Description: shows if the object to be estimated is inside of the k-nearest neighbor box; 0 indicates poor estimate

Column.Name: nnSpecz
Column.Description: spectroscopic redshift of the (first) nearest neighbor

Column.Name: nnAvgZ
Column.Description: average redshift of the nearest neighbors; if singificantly different from z, this might be a better estimate than z

Column.Name: distMod
Column.Description: the distance modulus for Omega=0.3, Lambda=0.7 cosmology

Column.Name: lumDist
Column.Description: the luminosity distance for Omega=0.3, Lambda=0.7 cosmology

Column.Name: chisq
Column.Description: the chi-square value for the best NNLS template fit

Column.Name: rnorm
Column.Description: the residual norm value for the best NNLS template fit

Column.Name: nTemplates
Column.Description: number of templates used in the fitting; if nTemplates=0 all the proceeding columns are invalid and may be filled with value -9999

Column.Name: synthU
Column.Description: synthetic u' magnitude calculated from the fitted templates

Column.Name: synthG
Column.Description: synthetic g' magnitude calculated from the fitted templates

Column.Name: synthR
Column.Description: synthetic r' magnitude calculated from the fitted templates

Column.Name: synthI
Column.Description: synthetic i' magnitude calculated from the fitted templates

Column.Name: synthZ
Column.Description: synthetic z' magnitude calculated from the fitted templates

Column.Name: PROX

Column.Name: PXPA

Column.Name: PXCNTR

Column.Name: DIST_EDGE_NS

Column.Name: DIST_EDGE_EW
Column.Description: The distance from the source to the nearest East or West scan edge.

Column.Name: DIST_EDGE_FLG
Column.Description: flag indicating which edges ([n|s][e|w]) are nearest to src.

Column.Name: v_off_forbidden
Column.Description: Velocity offset of the forbidden lines from the measured redshift

Column.Name: oii_3726_cont
Column.Description: Continuum at line center from 200 pixel median smoothing of the emission-line subtracted continuum

Column.Name: oii_3726_cont_err
Column.Description: Error in the continuum computed from the variance in the band pass

Column.Name: oii_3726_reqw
Column.Description: The equivalent width of the continuum-subtracted emission line computed from straight integration over the bandpasses listed below (emisison is negative). In this case the continuum comes from a running 200 pixel median and does not properly account for stellar absorption. In general the EQW measurements provide a better measure of the true equivalent width. The purpose of this measurement is to help characterize the stellar absorption effecting the line. (EW_stellar = REQW - EQW)

Column.Name: oii_3726_reqw_err
Column.Description: Error in the equivalent width described above

Column.Name: oii_3726_eqw
Column.Description: The equivalent width of the CB08 continuum-subtracted emission line computed from straight integration over the bandpasses listed below (emisison is negative) . This properly takes into account stellar absorption. Note that it will not be correct in the case of blended lines (ie NII & H-alpha) -- instead use FLUX/CONT.

Column.Name: oii_3726_eqw_err
Column.Description: Error in the equivalent width described above

Column.Name: oii_3726_flux
Column.Description: Flux from Gaussian fit to continuum subtracted data. (Note that the fit is done simultaneously to all the lines so de-blending happens automatically)

Column.Name: oii_3726_inst_res
Column.Description: Instrumental resolution at the line center (measured for each spectrum from the ARC lamps)

Column.Name: oii_3726_chisq
Column.Description: Reduced chi-squared of the line fit over the bandpass used for the EW measurement

Column.Name: oii_sigma
Column.Description: The width of the [O II] line in a free fit (ie. not tied to other emission lines)

Column.Name: oii_flux
Column.Description: The flux of the [O II] doublet from a free fit.

Column.Name: oii_voff
Column.Description: The velocity offset of the [O II] doublet from a free fit

Column.Name: oii_chi2
Column.Description: chi^2 of the fit to the [O II] line in free fit

Column.Name: oiii_sigma
Column.Description: The width of the [O III]5007 line in a free fit (ie. not tied to other emission lines)

Column.Name: oiii_flux
Column.Description: The flux of the [O III]5007 line from a free fit.

Column.Name: oiii_voff
Column.Description: The velocity offset of the [O III]5007 line from a free fit

Column.Name: oiii_chi2
Column.Description: chi^2 of the fit to the [O III]5007 line in free fit

Column.Name: spectofiber
Column.Description: The multiplicative scale factor applied to the original flux and error spectra prior to measurement of the emission lines to improve the spectrophotometric accuracy. The rescaling insures that a synthetic r-band magnitude computed from the spectrum matches the r-band fiber magnitude measured by the photometric pipeline.

Table.Name: Run
Table.Description: Contains the basic parameters associated with a ru

Column.Name: xBore
Column.Description: boresight offset perpendicular to great circle

Column.Name: fieldRef
Column.Description: Starting field number of full run (what MU_REF, MJD_REF refer to)

Column.Name: flavor
Column.Description: type of drift scan (from apacheraw, bias, calibration, engineering, ignore, and science)

Column.Name: xBin
Column.Description: binning amount perpendicular to scan direction

Column.Name: nRow
Column.Description: number of rows in output idR

Column.Name: mjdRef
Column.Description: MJD at row 0 of reference frame

Column.Name: muRef
Column.Description: mu value at row 0 of reference field

Column.Name: node
Column.Description: node of great circle, that is, its RA on the J2000 equator

Column.Name: incl
Column.Description: inclination of great circle relative to J2000 equator

Column.Name: qterm
Column.Description: quadratic term in coarse astrometric solution

Column.Name: maxMuResid
Column.Description: maximum residual from great circle in scan direction

Column.Name: maxNuResid
Column.Description: maximum residual from great circle perpendicular to scan direction

Column.Name: sasVersion
Column.Description: version of SAS used to produce CSV for this run

Table.Name: ProperMotions
Table.Description: Proper motions combining SDSS and recalibrated USNO-B astrometry

Column.Name: delta
Column.Description: Distance between this object and the nearest matching USNO-B object.

Column.Name: match
Column.Description: Number of objects in USNO-B which matched this object within a 1 arcsec radius. If negative, then the nearest matching USNO-B object itself matched more than 1 SDSS object.

Column.Name: pmRaErr
Column.Description: Error in proper motion in right ascension.

Column.Name: pmDecErr
Column.Description: Error in proper motion in declination.

Column.Name: sigRa
Column.Description: RMS residual for the proper motion fit in r.a.

Column.Name: sigDec
Column.Description: RMS residual for the proper motion fit in dec.

Column.Name: nFit
Column.Description: Number of detections used in the fit including the SDSS detection (thus, the number of plates the object was detected on in USNO-B plus one).

Column.Name: O
Column.Description: Recalibrated USNO-B O magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS g

Column.Name: E
Column.Description: Recalibrated USNO-B E magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS r

Column.Name: J
Column.Description: Recalibrated USNO-B J magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS g

Column.Name: F
Column.Description: Recalibrated USNO-B F magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS r

Column.Name: N
Column.Description: Recalibrated USNO-B N magnitude, recalibrated to SDSS i

Column.Name: dist20
Column.Description: Distance to the nearest neighbor with g < 20

Column.Name: dist22
Column.Description: Distance to the nearest neighbor with g < 22

Table.Name: galSpecExtra
Table.Description: Estimated physical parameters for all galaxies in the MPA-JHU spectroscopic catalogue

Column.Name: bptclass
Column.Description: Emission line classification based on the BPT diagram using the methodology described in Brinchmann et al (2004). -1 means unclassifiable, 1 is star-forming, 2 means low S/N star-forming, 3 is composite, 4 AGN (excluding liners) and 5 is a low S/N LINER.

Column.Name: oh_p2p5
Column.Description: The 2.5 percentile of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

Column.Name: oh_p16
Column.Description: The 16 percentile of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

Column.Name: oh_p50
Column.Description: The median estimate of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

Column.Name: oh_p84
Column.Description: The 84th percentile of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

Column.Name: oh_p97p5
Column.Description: The 97.5 percentile of the Oxygen abundance derived using Charlot & Longhetti models. The values are reported as 12 + Log O/H. See Tremonti et al (2004) and Brinchmann et al (2004) for details.

Column.Name: oh_entropy
Column.Description: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of 12 + Log O/H

Column.Name: lgm_tot_p2p5
Column.Description: The 2.5 percentile of the Log total stellar mass PDF using model photometry.

Column.Name: lgm_tot_p16
Column.Description: The 16th percentile of the Log total stellar mass PDF using model photometry.

Column.Name: lgm_tot_p50
Column.Description: The median estimate of the Log total stellar mass PDF using model photometry.

Column.Name: lgm_tot_p84
Column.Description: The 84th percentile of the Log total stellar mass PDF using model photometry.

Column.Name: lgm_tot_p97p5
Column.Description: The 97.5 percentile of the Log total stellar mass PDF using model photometry.

Column.Name: lgm_fib_p2p5
Column.Description: The 2.5 percentile of the Log stellar mass within the fibre PDF using fibre photometry.

Column.Name: lgm_fib_p16
Column.Description: The 16th percentile of the Log stellar mass within the fibre PDF using fibre photometry.

Column.Name: lgm_fib_p50
Column.Description: The median estimate of the Log stellar mass within the fibre PDF using fibre photometry.

Column.Name: lgm_fib_p84
Column.Description: The 84th percentile of the Log stellar mass within the fibre PDF using fibre photometry.

Column.Name: lgm_fib_p97p5
Column.Description: The 97.5 percentile of the Log stellar mass within the fibre PDF using fibre photometry.

Column.Name: sfr_tot_p2p5
Column.Description: The 2.5 percentile of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: sfr_tot_p16
Column.Description: The 16th percentile of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: sfr_tot_p50
Column.Description: The median estimate of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: sfr_tot_p84
Column.Description: The 84th percentile of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: sfr_tot_p97p5
Column.Description: The 97.5 percentile of the Log total SFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: sfr_tot_entropy
Column.Description: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of the total SFR

Column.Name: sfr_fib_p2p5
Column.Description: The 2.5 percentile of the Log SFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: sfr_fib_p16
Column.Description: The 16th percentile of the Log SFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: sfr_fib_p50
Column.Description: The median estimate of the Log SFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: sfr_fib_p84
Column.Description: The 84th percentile of the Log SFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: sfr_fib_p97p5
Column.Description: The 97.5 percentile of the Log SFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: sfr_fib_entropy
Column.Description: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of the fiber SFR

Column.Name: specsfr_tot_p2p5
Column.Description: The 2.5 percentile of the Log total SPECSFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: specsfr_tot_p16
Column.Description: The 16th percentile of the Log total SPECSFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: specsfr_tot_p50
Column.Description: The median estimate of the Log total SPECSFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: specsfr_tot_p84
Column.Description: The 84th percentile of the Log total SPECSFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: specsfr_tot_p97p5
Column.Description: The 97.5 percentile of the Log total SPECSFR PDF. This is derived by combining emission line measurements from within the fibre where possible and aperture corrections are done by fitting models ala Gallazzi et al (2005), Salim et al (2007) to the photometry outside the fibre. For those objects where the emission lines within the fibre do not provide an estimate of the SFR, model fits were made to the integrated photometry.

Column.Name: specsfr_tot_entropy
Column.Description: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of the total SPECSFR

Column.Name: specsfr_fib_p2p5
Column.Description: The 2.5 percentile of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: specsfr_fib_p16
Column.Description: The 16th percentile of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: specsfr_fib_p50
Column.Description: The median estimate of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: specsfr_fib_p84
Column.Description: The 84th percentile of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: specsfr_fib_p97p5
Column.Description: The 97.5 percentile of the Log SPECSFR within the fiber PDF. For galaxies of the star-forming class, emission lines were used (c.f. Brinchmann et al 2004) while for others models were fit to the fibre photometry..

Column.Name: specsfr_fib_entropy
Column.Description: The entropy (Sum p*lg(p)) of the PDF of the fiber SPECSFR

Column.Name: z

Column.Description: Layer of catalog (currently only one layer, 0; 0-15 available)

Column.Name: obj
Column.Description: The object id within a field. Usually changes between reruns of the same field

Column.Name: nChild
Column.Description: Number of children if this is a composite object that has been deblended. BRIGHT (in a flags sense) objects also have nchild == 1, the non-BRIGHT sibling.

Column.Name: type
Column.Description: Type classification of the object (star, galaxy, cosmic ray, etc.)

Column.Name: probPSF
Column.Description: Probability that the object is a star. Currently 0 if type == 3 (galaxy), 1 if type == 6 (star).

Column.Name: insideMask
Column.Description: Flag to indicate whether object is inside a mask and why

Table.Name: RC3
Table.Description: RC3 information for matches to SDSS photometr

Column.Name: RA
Column.Units: deg -/D J2000 right ascension in RC3

Column.Name: PGC
Column.Description: Principal Galaxy Catalog number (Paturel et al. 1989)

Column.Name: HUBBLE
Column.Description: revised Hubble type, coded as in RC2 (Section 3.3.a, page 13).

Column.Name: LOGD_25
Column.Description: mean decimal logarithm of the apparent major isophotal diameter measured at or reduced to surface brightness level mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2, as explained in Section 3.4.a, page 21. Unit of D is 0.1 arcmin to avoid negative entries.

Column.Name: LOGD_25Q
Column.Description: quality flag for isophotal diameter ("?" if bad)

Column.Name: LOGD_25ERR
Column.Description: error on mean decimal logarithm of the apparent major isophotal diameter

Column.Name: BT
Column.Description: total (asymptotic) magnitude in the B system

Column.Name: BTQ
Column.Description: quality flag total magnitude ("?" if bad)

Column.Name: BTERR
Column.Description: error in total (asymptotic) magnitude in the B system

Column.Name: BMVT
Column.Description: total (asymptotic) color index in Johnson B-V

Column.Name: BMVTERR
Column.Description: error in total (asymptotic) color index in Johnson B-V

Column.Name: BMVE
Column.Description: color index within effective aperture in Johnson B-V

Column.Name: BMVEERR
Column.Description: error in color index within effective aperture in Johnson B-V

Column.Name: M21
Column.Description: 21-cm emission line magnitude, defined by by m_21 = 21.6 - 2.5 log(S_H), where S_H is the measured neutral hydrogen flux density in units of 10^-24 W/m^2.

Column.Name: V21
Column.Description: mean heliocentric radial velocity from HI observations

Column.Name: LOGR_25
Column.Description: mean decimal logarithm of the ratio of the major isophotal diameter, D_25, to the minor isophotal diameter, d_25, measured at or reduced to the surface brightness level mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2.

Column.Name: LOGR_25ERR
Column.Description: error in decimal logarithm of the ratio of the major isophotal diameter to minor

Column.Name: MB
Column.Description: photographic magnitude reduced to B_T system

Column.Name: UMBT
Column.Description: total (asymptotic) color index in Johnson U-B

Column.Name: UMBTERR
Column.Description: error in total (asymptotic) color index in Johnson U-B

Column.Name: UMBE
Column.Description: color index within effective aperture in Johnson U-B

Column.Name: UMBEERR
Column.Description: error in color index within effective aperture in Johnson U-B

Column.Name: W20
Column.Description: neutral hydrogen line full width (in km/s) measured at the 20% level (I_20/I_max)

Column.Name: VOPT
Column.Description: mean heliocentric radial velocity from optical observations

Column.Name: VOPTERR
Column.Description: error in mean heliocentric radial velocity from optical observations

Column.Name: TYPE
Column.Description: T = mean numerical index of stage along the Hubble sequence in the RC2 system (coded as explained in Section 3.3.c, page 16)

Column.Name: LOGA_E
Column.Description: decimal logarithm of the apparent diameter (in 0.1 arcmin) of the ``effective aperture,'' the circle centered on the nucleus within which one-half of the total B-band flux is emitted

Column.Name: LOGA_EERR
Column.Description: error in decimal logarithm of the apparent diameter (in 0.1 arcmin) of the ``effective aperture,''

Column.Name: AIB
Column.Description: internal extinction (for correction to face-on), calcauled from size and T-type

Column.Name: MFIR
Column.Description: far-infrared magnitude calculated from m_FIR = - 20.0 - 2.5 logFIR, where FIR is the far infrared continuum flux measured at 60 and 100 microns as listed in the IRAS Point Source Catalog (1987).

Column.Name: BMVT0
Column.Description: total B-V color index corrected for Galactic and internal extinction, and for redshift

Column.Name: MPE
Column.Description: mean B-band surface brightness in magnitudes per square arcmin (B-mag/arcmin^2) within the effective aperture A_e, and its mean error, as given by the relation MPE = B_T + 0.75 + 5logA_e - 5.26.

Column.Name: MPEERR
Column.Description: error in mean B-band surface brightness

Column.Name: W50
Column.Description: neutral hydrogen line full width (in km/s) measured at the 50% level (I_20/I_max)

Column.Name: W50ERR
Column.Description: error in neutral hydrogen line full width (in km/s) measured at the 50% level (I_20/I_max)

Column.Name: VGSR
Column.Description: the weighted mean of the neutral hydrogen and optical velocities, corrected to the ``Galactic standard of rest''

Column.Name: LERR
Column.Description: mean numerical luminosity class in the RC2 system

Column.Name: LOGD0
Column.Description: decimal logarithm of the isophotal major diameter corrected to ``face-on'' (inclination = 0 degrees), and corrected for Galactic extinction to A_g = 0, but not for redshift

Column.Name: SA21
Column.Description: HI line self-absorption in magnitudes (for correction to face-on), calculated from logR and T >= 1

Column.Name: BT0
Column.Description: B_T^0 = total ``face-on'' magnitude corrected for Galactic and internal extinction, and for redshift

Column.Name: UMBT0
Column.Description: (U-B)_T^0 = total U-B color index corrected for Galactic and internal extinction, and for redshift

Column.Name: MP25
Column.Description: the mean surface brightness in magnitudes per square arcmin (B-mag/arcmin^2) within the mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2 elliptical isophote of major axis D_25 and axis ratio R_25

Column.Name: MP25ERR
Column.Description: error inthe mean surface brightness within the mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2

Column.Name: HI
Column.Description: corrected neutral hydrogen index, which is the difference m_21^0 - B_T^0 between the corrected (face-on) 21-cm emission line magnitude and the similarly corrected magnitude in the B_T system.

Column.Name: V3K
Column.Description: the weighted mean velocity corrected to the reference frame defined by the 3 K microwave background radiation
